oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Nelson Andrews, 2006 August 25, excerpt 05
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville business and civic leader Nelson Andrews, conducted on 25 August 2006 by Cabot Pyle as part of the Nashville Public Library's Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project: The Turner Interviews. Andrews discusses the civil rights movement in Nashville and the role of Nashville businessmen, including David Kirkpatrick (Pat) Wilson. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Andrews, Nelson--Interviews
